title: Preparation for the Temple
shortSummary: In 1 Chronicles 22, King David prepares for the building of the temple by gathering materials, skilled workers, and instructing his son Solomon to carry out the task. This chapter highlights God's sovereign plan, the importance of obedience, and the passing of responsibility to the next generation to fulfill divine purposes.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David in Israel

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: King of Israel who initiates the preparation for the temple but is told by God he will not build it due to his history of warfare.

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: David’s son, chosen by God to build the temple and establish peace during his reign.

keyCharacters.name: Princes of Israel
keyCharacters.description: Leaders commanded by David to support Solomon in building the temple.

definitions.definition: A sacred structure where sacrifices were offered to God as an act of worship and atonement.
Skilled stone workers who shape and prepare stones for building structures, essential for temple construction.
An ancient unit of weight and value, often used to measure large quantities of precious metals like gold and silver.
The holy place or temple where God’s presence dwells and where worship is conducted.

outline.heading: David’s Preparations for the Temple
outline.description: David identifies the site for the temple and begins gathering materials and skilled laborers, emphasizing the importance of building a magnificent house for the Lord.

outline.heading: David Charges Solomon to Build the Temple
outline.description: David instructs Solomon to build the temple, explaining that God has chosen Solomon because David’s life of warfare disqualifies him from the task.

outline.heading: Encouragement and Instructions for Solomon
outline.description: David prays for Solomon’s success, urging him to seek wisdom, obey God’s laws, and be courageous in fulfilling his divine calling.

outline.heading: Resources and Support for the Temple Construction
outline.description: David details the vast resources he has prepared, including gold, silver, brass, iron, timber, and skilled workers, encouraging Solomon to begin the work.

outline.heading: David Commands the Princes to Assist Solomon
outline.description: David calls on Israel’s leaders to support Solomon, reminding them of God’s provision and urging them to wholeheartedly seek the Lord and build the sanctuary.

application: Prepare diligently and prayerfully for the tasks God calls you to, trusting His timing and provision.
Seek God’s wisdom and understanding daily, especially when facing significant responsibilities.
Encourage and support others in their God-given assignments, recognizing the importance of unity in accomplishing His work.
Be strong and courageous in obedience to God’s commands, knowing He is with you.

keyVerses.text: Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about: for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals God’s promise of peace through Solomon, highlighting the divine plan for the temple and the kingdom.

keyVerses.text: Now, my son, the LORD be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of the LORD thy God, as he hath said of thee.
keyVerses.significance: David’s blessing upon Solomon underscores the importance of God’s presence and favor in fulfilling His purposes.

keyVerses.text: Then shalt thou prosper, if thou takest heed to fulfil the statutes and judgments which the LORD charged Moses with concerning Israel: be strong, and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed.
keyVerses.significance: This verse encourages obedience to God’s law and courage in leadership as keys to success.
